content.raw:
I am testing this. At line 2837 in ModelListWidget

this->FillPoseProperty(_msg.pose(), topItem);

it says this:

no matching function for call to ‘gazebo::gui::ModelListWidget::FillPoseProperty(const ignition::msgs::Pose&, QtProperty*&)’

I think we need to convert the pose part to gazebo::msgs again or to write a new FillPoseProperty function. What do you think?
content.html:
I am testing this. At line 2837 in ModelListWidget

this->FillPoseProperty(_msg.pose(), topItem);

it says this:

no matching function for call to ‘gazebo::gui::ModelListWidget::FillPoseProperty(const ignition::msgs::Pose&, QtProperty*&)’

I think we need to convert the pose part to gazebo::msgs again or to write a new FillPoseProperty function. What do you think?

content.raw: yes, it should be same for consistency. Suggestion: For pluginInfo it is the same implementation for gui, sensors, visuals, world, model then. A decoupled pluginInfo function could be used instead of 5 equal implementations.
content.html: yes, it should be same for consistency. Suggestion: For pluginInfo it is the same implementation for gui, sensors, visuals, world, model then. A decoupled pluginInfo function could be used instead of 5 equal implementations.

content.raw:
because we always hand over a nullptr as parent in the update() function. It will always result as in a return then. For plugins and the other update types it is also removed.

this->FillPropertyTree(this->dataPtr->visualMsg, nullptr);

content.raw: Why is this check removed?
content.html: Why is this check removed?

content.raw:
This is probably generating a URI like this: `data://visual/model_name::link_name::visual_name`. 

Shouldn't it be `data://world/world_name/model/model_name/link/link_name/visual/visual_name`?
content.html:
This is probably generating a URI like this: data://visual/model_name::link_name::visual_name.

Shouldn't it be data://world/world_name/model/model_name/link/link_name/visual/visual_name?

content.raw: indentation here
content.html: indentation here

content.raw: I think this approach of looking for chunks of string can be a bit risky. We can have a model called "sensor", a visual called "world" and so on. A more robust check would involve breaking the URI into parts and checking that the parts are in the positions they should be.
content.html: I think this approach of looking for chunks of string can be a bit risky. We can have a model called "sensor", a visual called "world" and so on. A more robust check would involve breaking the URI into parts and checking that the parts are in the positions they should be.

content.html: It should be enough to include #include <ignition/transport/Node.hh>

content.raw: This should be already possible
content.html: This should be already possible

content.raw: We should explain in the description that we're talking about Visuals of the `VT_VISUAL` type. For rendering, `rendering::Visual` is the base class for displaying everything from models to links, collisions and "visuals". But here we're only handling visuals in the Gazebo model sense.
content.html: We should explain in the description that we're talking about Visuals of the VT_VISUAL type. For rendering, rendering::Visual is the base class for displaying everything from models to links, collisions and "visuals". But here we're only handling visuals in the Gazebo model sense.

According to the header, the URI format is

      ///    data://world/<this_name>/model/<model_name>/link/
      ///    <link_name>/visual/<visual_name>/plugin/<plugin_name>

Should we stick to it?

content.raw:
You could use the SDF to ign-msgs conversion, something like this:

~~~
auto visualMsg->CopyFrom(util::Convert<ignition::msgs::Visual>(visual->GetSDF()))
~~~
content.html:
You could use the SDF to ign-msgs conversion, something like this:

auto visualMsg->CopyFrom(util::Convert<ignition::msgs::Visual>(visual->GetSDF()))

content.raw: Also, at some point we should check the visual type to make sure it's a `VT_VISUAL`, otherwise the SDF might represent something else, like a model or a link.
content.html: Also, at some point we should check the visual type to make sure it's a VT_VISUAL, otherwise the SDF might represent something else, like a model or a link.

According to the header, the URI format is 

      ///    data://world/<this_name>/model/<model_name>/link/
      ///    <link_name>/visual/<visual_name>

Should we stick to it?

content.html: -> /gui/info/plugin
